headline: Keto Open-Faced Chicken Cordon Bleu
description: This recipe has all the flavors of chicken cordon bleu but is keto-friendly and easier to assemble since there is no stuffing or rolling involved.
name: Keto Open-Faced Chicken Cordon Bleu
recipeIngredient: 1 pound chicken cutlets, pounded to 1/4-inch thickness
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Season chicken cutlets with salt and pepper; set aside.

Whisk eggs and Dijon mustard together in a shallow bowl. Combine almond flour, Parmesan cheese, and garlic powder in a separate shallow bowl. Dip chicken cutlets into egg mixture, letting excess drip off. Dredge with almond flour mixture, then set on a plate.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken cutlets and cook until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Flip over and cook until chicken is no longer pink inside and the juices are running clear, 3 to 4 minutes more.
Place chicken cutlets on a baking sheet. Top with ham slices and cover with Swiss cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese has melted, 4 to 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: This recipe calls for a LOT of breading and eggs compared to what was needed (perhaps I needed to pound those breasts out thinner). I will go back to my old recipes for the breading. Aside from that, putting a slice of ham and some shredded cheese on top was a simple and tasty way to dress up the chicken.
easy and very tasty! My husband liked it and we will make this again.

This was yummy, I have made it a couple of times now. I did add a little extra to the seasonings of the flour dredge, some smoked paprika, onion powder, salt and pepper, just to our taste. I will make this again and again. My family loved it! Thanks for a great recipe!
Made as written, used lunch meat ham and grated jack cheese. Easy and tasty .... but it is very FRIED and just isn't as "healthy" as I wanted.
Nice and quick recipe for a weeknight dinner. Definitely easier than rolling the chicken. The family loved the flavor.
Swiss cheese is a sub-par choice, breading was good but fairly standard/common.
Delicious! Family loved this and I will be making this again!
I didn't have avocado oil so I used olive oil. So easy to make and OMG loved it!!
Great! We are not on keto so I used regular flour. Much easier than 'real' cordon bleu, but with a great taste. I put some paprika in as well.
This was a hit for me because it is Keto but my husband loved it as well!
So yummy and easy to make.
The almond flour is different!

I usually donâ€™t write reviews but I had to on this recipe. I followed the instructions and it came out sooo good . For anybody on Keto this is a keeper. Thanks for sharing this. I most definitely will make this again

This dish was AMAZING (and husband approved - which is a WIN in my house!)! Very simple and quick, but also very tasty! I think next time I'm going to spice up my breading a little bit more, and possibly add a little more mustard, but overall, great recipe!
Really good and a easier way to do this recipe!
Yum! This was so easy and so so good. I used olive oil rather than buy avocado oil and sliced Swiss since that was what I had already. This one will be a staple in my low carb rotation!
Very easy & not heavy at all. Made exactly as written - husband loved it - will certainly do again.
Pretty good.

Great recipe! I did not season the chicken, but added 1/2 tsp of kosher salt and 1/4 tsp ground pepper to the dry mix. I also used grated Parmesan from a can, and it turned out really well. I will definitely make this again, and may add some crushed rosemary next time.
I am definitely going to make this recipe! Finally a dish that does not have a gazillion mg of sodium and, is still carb and calorie friendly!!
